required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Performance Indicators and Patient Experience in 7G and 10G Vacuum-assisted Excision of Probably Benign Breast Lesions
clinical_study.official_title: Performance Indicators and Patient Experience in 7G and 10G Vacuum-assisted Excision of Probably Benign Breast Lesions

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess how the needle size 7G vs 10G affects performance indicators and patient experience in vacuum-assisted excision (VAE) of probably benign breast lesions

detailed_description.textblock: After being informed about the study and potential risks, all patients giving written informed consent will have a VAE procedure to remove their breast lesion and will be randomised to either 7G or 10G needle size. After completion of the procedure, the patients fill out a questionnaire to collect data on their experience. The radiologist performing the procedure fills out a form collecting procedural performance indicators.

primary_outcome.description: Time from excision start to excision stop - reported by radiologist

primary_outcome.measure: Pain assessed by NRS 2 weeks after baseline
primary_outcome.description: Patient pain level during the experience - reported by patient in a 10-level NRS

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with bleeding despite 10 minutes compression
secondary_outcome.description: Bleeding despite 10 minutes compression - reported by radiologist
Number of fractions possible to perform after the lesion has visually been removed - reported by radiologist

secondary_outcome.measure: Self-reported number of patients who would recommend the procedure to others
secondary_outcome.description: Would the patient recommend the same procedure to others in same situation - reported by patient as yes or no

secondary_outcome.measure: Self-reported satisfaction with cosmetic result assessed by a categorical scale
secondary_outcome.description: How dissatisfied is the patient with the cosmetic result - reported by patient - using a categorical scale from "not at all", "somewhat", "rather", "very".

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with self-reported occurrence of wound infection
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence of wound infection - reported by patient as yes or no
Yes = Any sign of prior trauma to the skin, No = Otherwise, Reported by radiologist as assessed by visual inspection

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain assessed by NRS at baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Patient pain level during procedure - reported by patient in a 10-level NRS

intervention.description: Vacuum-assisted excision using a biopsy needle with two alternative dimensions
Vacuum-assisted excision using a biopsy needle with two alternative dimensions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Biopsy-verified probably benign breast lesion less than 20 mm size
- Biopsy-verified benign breast lesion less than 30 mm size
- Screen-detected group of microcalcifications under 10 mm size
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age less than 18 years of age
- Inability to understand the meaning of informed consent
- Pregnancy
- Breast-feeding
